message:
1. Nope. It still works the same today.
2. Hyper-threading and simultaneous threading are both forms of multithreading. From a programming perspective, they're practically the same thing; you have multiple threads and how exactly they're implemented doesn't matter (for the most part). Multithreading (and thus hyper-threading and simultaneous threading) aren't directly related to asynchronous programming; asynchronous programming is about using *fewer* threads by not blocking them.
